messages.message:
Hi :wave: ,

We’re planning to enable `readOnlyRootFileSystem` policy in our main `dogfood` cluster.  This Policy prevents any sort of Write operations in the root filesystem of the Container by any process running in it. We’re in process to fix some of our services which are failing to start under this Policy and This is the JIRA ticket (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/PRODENG-102) to track the same.

Once this policy is enabled we can verify and make sure that we don’t see any unexpected runtime issues due to this policy when running our day to day operations.

This policy will be enabled on Wednesday 23rd 9 p.m PST as we need to enough time to identify every arcane issue related to it before we cut our next Major release in July.
@Aaron Vontell this will affect model service writing to /tmp
@Shubham Oli we’ll need to make /tmp writable for model service.
Yeah this is vital for model service
I believe Nidhi is already aware of this. But just surfacing in thread for wandering eyes - SDLC in core-tasks will also be impacted.
yep -- there is also a jira for core-tasks (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/PRODENG-104) for this
cc @Balaram in case we write to container storage in flows
